description:
Just like you, the Tacx Flux Trainer is getting stronger over time. It's now upgraded with a heavier flywheel to give it a more realistic road feel. The resistance got a tweak to make sure you never reach its max level. At maximum 2000 Watts and 16% simulated incline, it's a given that you'll tap out long before the trainer does. Design-wise, it also has lowered front legs so it clears long-cage derailleurs.

  • Direct drive trainer ensures that every Watt you generate is accounted for
  • 8 permanent ferrite magnets and 8 electromagnets
  • Power reading accuracy of +/- 2.5% requires calibration for best results
  • Maximum brake power of 2000W
  • Heavy 7.6kg (18.8lbs.) flywheel, with a flywheel effect of 31.2kg (68.8lbs.) for a road-like feel
  • Cassette body fits Shimano and SRAM 8, 9, 10 & 11 speed cassettes. Campagnolo, SRAM XD and XD-R cassette bodies are sold separately. Not suitable for specialized SCS system
  • Cassette not included, sold separately
  • Compatible with 130mm and 135mm quick release axles
  • Adaptors included for 142x12mm and 148x12mm axles included. Adaptors for 10x135 sold separately
  • Realistic slope simulation of up to 16%
  • ERG mode allows you to maintain effort level regardless of your cadence
  • LEDs confirm ANT+ and Bluetooth connection
  • FE-C and Bluetooth smart control allows you to focus on your training and let an app change the resistance
  • Controllable by Tacx app, Zwift, TrainerRoad, Kinomap and many others
  • Large, well-balanced footprint of 67 x 64.2cm (26.4 x 25.3in.)
name: Tacx Flux 2 Smart Bike Trainer
